content.GPT-summary: The post is an update on a proposal that has been merged with another proposal. The author is explaining the situation and providing an archived version of the original proposal. There is no feedback or criticism given, and no collaboration or auditing is mentioned.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author is advertising proposal

content.content: I notice your concurrent proposal - Atila, how does this differ from Arthouse? At a quick glance it seems to be the same user metrics, OP tokens requested, and distribution schedule. It also both seems to benefit and empower students. Is there a reason for separating these two proposals versus aggregating them into one?

Good question @fig. I conisdered about both options. I thought keeping it separate might make it easier for the reviewers to judge the merits of both proposals separately But after reading your comment, I can see how it might be better to combine them. I’ve updated the description and umerged both proposals into the Atila proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
